name: Daphne's Green Beans
author: carina
summary: I created this recipe for someone who loves everything spicy. Now this has  become a family favorite.  Serve hot, cold, or at room temperature. These green beans are delicious!
ingredients: 1  chipotle pepper in adobo sauce, minced
1 pound fresh green beans - rinsed, trimmed and snapped into bite size pieces
directions: Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until bacon is crisp, 6 to 8 minutes
Remove bacon to a plate lined with paper towels to drain
Reserve 1 tablespoon of the bacon fat from the skillet, discarding the rest
Return the reserved bacon fat to the skillet and heat
Cook and stir the onion, garlic, and chipotle pepper in the heated bacon fat until the garlic is fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes
Add the adobo sauce and tomatoes; cook another 2 minutes
Stir in the green beans, water, honey, seasoned salt, and pepper
Bring the mixture to a boil, cover the pan, lower the heat to medium-low, and simmer until the green beans are tender, 30 to 40 minutes
Sprinkle the bacon pieces and lemon juice over the green beans
